availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Sangston Carpenter (Hamilton County, Ohio, lawyer and soldier.)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, lawyer, commissioner of deeds, and soldier. Lancaster County, Pennsylvania, native. Son of Emanuel Carpenter and Sarah Stevens Carpenter. Married to Louisa Carmen Carpenter in Hamilton County, Ohio, on October 1, 1846. Father of Ernest Carpenter, Edwin James Carpenter, Charles S. Carpenter, Samuel Warner Carpenter, Sarah Carmen Louise Carpenter, Frank Giles Carpenter, John H. Carpenter, and Elizabeth Carpenter. Graduate of Franklin College in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania. Attorney in Hamilton County, Ohio in 1850. Attorney in Hamilton County in 1860. Employed Norah Gorman and Mary O'Neal as domestic servants in Hamilton County in 1860. Commissioner of deeds for the state Kentucky in Hamilton County in 1861. Served in the 39th Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from July 14, 1861 to January 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati/Ward 2, p. 111B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Springfield, p. 336.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Springfield, p. 601B.

"Death of a Lawyer," Lancaster Daily Intelligencer (PA), August 14, 1889.
Official roster of the soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1865 Vol. IV (Akron, OH: Wernet PTG. and MFG. Co., 1887), 95.
U.S., Passport Applications, 1795-1925, Volume 12: Special Series - Chicago, No. 3278.
KYR-0001-017-0230.
